oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1961-07-24 Correspondence and Opinion
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: libraries; civil rights; desegregation; law; public restrooms; Russell, Edward P.; Miller, William E.; 1960s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A letter from attorney Edward P. Russell to Wassell Randolph introduces the court opinion of Judge William E. Miller. Judge Miller opines that the library facilities must be desegregated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Miller, William E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: IntLib046, IntLib047, IntLib048, IntLib049, IntLib050, IntLib051, IntLib052, IntLib053, IntLib054
